glsa.title: nginx: Arbitrary code execution
glsa.synopsis: A vulnerability has been found in nginx which may allow execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: nginx is a robust, small, and high performance HTTP and reverse proxy server.

description.p: A bug in the SPDY implementation in nginx was found which might cause a heap memory buffer overflow in a worker process by using a specially crafted request. The SPDY implementation is not enabled in default configurations.

impact.p: A remote attacker could cause execution of arbitrary code by using a specially crafted request.

workaround.p: Disable the spdy module in NGINX_MODULES_HTTP.

resolution.p: All nginx users should upgrade to the latest version:
